errors.error: panic: runtime error: index out of range
errors.description: An attempt to access an array index that does not exist.
errors.solution: Check the array length before accessing an index.
errors.cause: The specified index is out of the array's bounds.

errors.error: TypeError: Cannot read property 'xyz' of undefined
errors.description: Attempting to access a property of an undefined or null value.
errors.solution: Ensure that the object is defined and initialized before accessing its properties.
errors.cause: The referenced object or variable is undefined or null.

errors.description: A variable or function is being used before it has been declared or initialized.
errors.solution: Declare the variable or function before using it.
errors.cause: The variable or function is not in scope at the time of access.

errors.description: An unexpected or invalid token (character or symbol) in the code.
errors.solution: Check the syntax of the code, especially near the error location.
errors.cause: A typo or incorrect syntax (e.g., a missing parenthesis, bracket, etc.).

errors.error: Uncaught Error: Request failed with status code 404
errors.description: The server could not find the requested resource.
errors.solution: Check the URL, ensure the resource exists on the server, or handle the 404 error appropriately.
errors.cause: The requested URL or endpoint is incorrect or does not exist.

errors.description: Attempting to access a property of undefined.
errors.solution: Check if the object is defined and initialized before accessing its properties.
errors.cause: The object is undefined, meaning it hasn't been created or assigned a value yet.

errors.description: The Java Virtual Machine (JVM) has run out of memory while trying to allocate more space.
errors.solution: Increase the Java heap size by adjusting the `-Xmx` JVM option or optimize memory usage in the application.
errors.cause: The application is consuming more memory than allocated, possibly due to memory leaks or large data structures.

errors.description: A Python module could not be found.
errors.solution: Ensure the module is installed using `pip` or check for typos in the module name.
errors.cause: The required Python module is either not installed or not correctly named.

errors.description: Attempting to import a function or class that doesn't exist in the specified module.
errors.solution: Check the module for the correct function or class name and ensure it’s properly exported.
errors.cause: The function or class is not defined in the specified module.

errors.description: Attempting to access an attribute or method on a `None` (null) object in Python.
errors.solution: Check if the object is `None` before attempting to access its attributes or methods.
errors.cause: The object is `None`, and therefore doesn't have the requested attribute.

errors.description: The application’s call stack has exceeded the maximum allowed size.
errors.solution: Check for infinite recursion or excessive method calls in the code.
errors.cause: A recursive function may not have a proper base case, causing infinite recursion.

errors.description: The requested resource could not be found on the server.
errors.solution: Verify that the requested resource exists or handle the error gracefully with a custom 404 page.
errors.cause: The resource doesn't exist or the URL is incorrect.

errors.description: The server is temporarily unable to handle the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.
errors.solution: Check the server's health, resolve any overload issues, or try the request again later.
errors.cause: The server is overwhelmed or under maintenance.

errors.description: The network connection was refused by the target server.
errors.solution: Verify that the server is running and that the correct IP and port are used.
errors.cause: The server is unreachable or not accepting connections.

errors.description: A network connection attempt was refused.
errors.solution: Ensure that the server is up and reachable, check network configurations, and retry.
errors.cause: The connection attempt was rejected by the target machine.

errors.description: Access denied to the MySQL server with the provided credentials.
errors.solution: Ensure that the username and password are correct and have sufficient privileges.
errors.cause: Incorrect login credentials or insufficient user privileges.

errors.error: Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory
errors.description: A file or directory cannot be found in the specified path.
errors.solution: Check that the file or directory exists and that the path is correct.
errors.cause: The specified file or directory does not exist or the path is incorrect.

errors.description: An HTTP request has failed, usually due to a network error.
errors.solution: Check the network connection and ensure the endpoint is correct and responsive.
errors.cause: Network issues, incorrect endpoint, or server issues.

errors.description: The Python interpreter runs out of memory.
errors.solution: Optimize memory usage, or increase available memory if possible.
errors.cause: The system ran out of memory due to inefficient code or a large data set.

errors.description: An attempt to call a method on a `nil` (null) object in Ruby.
errors.solution: Ensure the object is not `nil` before invoking the method.
errors.cause: The object being called is `nil` or has not been initialized.

errors.error: Error: 'xyz' is not a valid URL
errors.description: The provided string is not a valid URL.
errors.solution: Check the URL format and ensure it follows the proper syntax.
errors.cause: The string provided does not conform to valid URL standards.

errors.description: The code file ends unexpectedly, usually due to a missing parenthesis, bracket, or end keyword.
errors.solution: Check for unmatched parentheses or missing end statements.
errors.cause: An incomplete or improperly closed code block.

errors.error: TypeError: x is not a function
errors.description: A non-function value is being invoked as a function.
errors.solution: Ensure the value being called is a function and not another type (e.g., string or number).
errors.cause: The value being invoked is not a callable function.
